document_title: Hepatitis B: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
1. Symptoms of acute hepatitis B
Abdominal pain is a symptom of hepatitis B
Most children under 5 years old or people with weakened immune systems with acute hepatitis B do not show obvious symptoms. Of the remaining subjects, including older children, adolescents and adults, about 30 - 50% will have early signs and symptoms, including:
Fever; Tired; Loss of appetite, loss of appetite; Nausea and vomiting; Stomach-ache; Dark urine; Pale stools; Athritis; Jaundice
Symptoms of acute infection appear about 60 - 150 days after exposure to the virus and last from a few weeks to 6 months. Symptoms are often more severe in patients over 60 years old. (first)
2. Symptoms of chronic hepatitis B
Most people with chronic hepatitis B do not have any symptoms for many years. If symptoms occur, they will be similar to those of acute infection. In case a patient has had hepatitis B for a long time before showing symptoms, there is a high possibility that these are symptoms of dangerous complications of hepatitis B such as cirrhosis or liver cancer, not just liver cancer. It's purely hepatitis.
